course_overview: This comprehensive course teaches Python programming from absolute zero. Starting with installation and environment setup, students progress through variables, data types, control flow, functions, and file handling. Through 40+ coding exercises and 5 portfolio projects (including a text-based game and data analyzer), learners develop problem-solving skills using industry-standard tools like VS Code and Git. The curriculum emphasizes clean code practices, debugging techniques, and computational thinking, culminating in object-oriented programming foundations. Includes Python 3.10 syntax, error handling, and best practices for maintainable code.
target_audience: Absolute beginners with no coding background, career switchers, students, and professionals seeking foundational programming skills for automation or data analysis.
learning_outcomes: Write executable Python scripts using correct syntax and indentation rules
Implement control structures (if-statements, loops) to solve computational problems
Manipulate core data structures (lists, dictionaries, tuples) for data organization
Create reusable functions with parameters and return values
Handle file input/output operations for data persistence
Debug code using error messages and print statements
Apply object-oriented principles by designing simple classes
